newsitem.title: CANADA: Bank of Canada sets specials at 3.25 pct - traders.
newsitem.headline: Bank of Canada sets specials at 3.25 pct - traders.

text.p: The Bank of Canada conducted a round of special purchase and resale agreements in the money markets on Monday at 3.25 percent, dealers said.
Yields had been moving up ahead of today's T-bill auction, which is being held a day early due to market holidays this week.
They said the central bank intervened after Canada's call loan rate rose to the upper limit of the Bank of Canada's 50 basis point target range at 3.25 percent from 3.0 percent this morning.
"It has really tightened up there and it was 3.25 percent bid on the screen," one dealer said.
The yield on Canada's three-month when-issued T-bill held steady at 2.91 percent, one basis point higher than Friday's close.
